blocks.name: impexpd
blocks.content:
The following User's Proof is a Virtual Deduction proof completed automatically by the tools program completeusersproof.cmd, which invokes Mel L. O'Cat's mmj2 and Norm Megill's Metamath Proof Assistant. After the User's Proof was completed, it was minimized. The completed User's Proof before minimization is not shown. (Contributed by Alan Sare, 18-Mar-2012.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
1:: ` |- ( ( ( ps /\ ch ) -> th ) <-> ( ps -> ( ch -> ` ` th ) ) ) `
qed:1: ` |- ( ( ph -> ( ( ps /\ ch ) -> th ) ) <-> ( ph ` ` -> ( ps -> ( ch -> th ) ) ) ) `

blocks.name: pm2.43bgbi
blocks.content:
Logical equivalence of a 2-left-nested implication and a 1-left-nested implicated when two antecedents of the former implication are identical. (Contributed by Alan Sare, 18-Mar-2012.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.) The following User's Proof is a Virtual Deduction proof completed automatically by the tools program completeusersproof.cmd, which invokes Mel L. O'Cat's mmj2 and Norm Megill's Metamath Proof Assistant. The completed Virtual Deduction Proof (not shown) was minimized. The minimized proof is shown.
1:: ` |- ( ( ph -> ( ps -> ( ph -> ch ) ) ) ` ` -> ( ph -> ( ph -> ( ps -> ch ) ) ) ) `
2:: ` |- ( ( ph -> ( ph -> ( ps -> ch ) ) ) ` ` -> ( ph -> ( ps -> ch ) ) ) `
3:1,2: ` |- ( ( ph -> ( ps -> ( ph -> ch ) ) ) ` ` -> ( ph -> ( ps -> ch ) ) ) `
4:: ` |- ( ( ph -> ( ps -> ch ) ) -> ( ps ` ` -> ( ph -> ch ) ) ) `
5:3,4: ` |- ( ( ph -> ( ps -> ( ph -> ch ) ) ) ` ` -> ( ps -> ( ph -> ch ) ) ) `
6:: ` |- ( ( ps -> ( ph -> ch ) ) -> ( ph ` ` -> ( ps -> ( ph -> ch ) ) ) ) `
qed:5,6: ` |- ( ( ph -> ( ps -> ( ph -> ch ) ) ) ` ` <-> ( ps -> ( ph -> ch ) ) ) `

blocks.origin:
thm ee233(wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4, wff w5, wff w6) {
  |- wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w2, w3)))
  -| wi(w0, wi(w1, w4))
  -| wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w2, w5)))
  -| wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w2, w6)))
  -| wi(w4, wi(w5, wi(w6, w3)))
} = {
  mpbi(wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w2, w3))), wi(w2, wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w2, w3)))))
  mpbi(wi(w2, wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w2, w3)))), wi(w1, wi(w2, wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w2, w3))))))
  mpbi(wi(w1, wi(w2, wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w2, w3))))), wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w2, wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w2, w3)))))))
  syl8(w0, w1, w2, wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w2, w3))), w6)
  com14(w6, w0, w1, w2, w3)
  mpbi(wi(w2, wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w6, w3)))), wi(w1, wi(w2, wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w6, w3))))))
  mpbi(wi(w1, wi(w2, wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w6, w3))))), wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w2, wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w6, w3)))))))
  syl8(w0, w1, w2, wi(w0, wi(w1, wi(w6, w3))), w5)
  com3r(w5, w0, w1, wi(w6, w3))
  syl6(w0, w1, wi(w5, wi(w6, w3)), w4)
  pm2.43cbi(w0, w1, w2, wi(w1, wi(w6, w3)))
  pm2.43cbi(w1, w2, w0, wi(w6, w3))
  pm2.43cbi(w0, w1, w2, wi(w1, wi(w2, w3)))
  pm2.43cbi(w1, w2, w0, wi(w2, w3))
  pm2.43cbi(w2, w0, w1, w3)
}

blocks.content: Equivalence for substitution. Alternate proof of ~ sb5 . This proof is ~ sb5ALTVD automatically translated and minimized. (Contributed by Alan Sare, 21-Apr-2013.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm sb5ALT(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0) {
  |- wb(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  impbii(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)))
  syl(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)), wsb(s0, s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)))
  mpi(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wsb(s0, s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)), wsb(s0, s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  equsb1(s0, s1)
  simplbi2com(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wsb(s0, s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wsb(s0, s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)))
  sban(s0, s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)
  spsbe(s0, s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0))
  exlimexi(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0), wsb(s0, s1, w0))
  hbs1(s0, s1, w0)
  syl6c(wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)), wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0), wsb(s0, s1, w0), w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  a1i(wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)), wi(wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0), w0))
  simpr(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)
  a1i(wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)), wi(wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  simpl(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)
  com12(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wsb(s0, s1, w0))
  sbequ1(s1, s0, w0)
}

blocks.name: vk15.4j
blocks.content: Excercise 4j of Unit 15 of "Understanding Symbolic Logic", Fifth Edition (2008), by Virginia Klenk. This proof is the minimized Hilbert-style axiomatic version of the Fitch-style Natural Deduction proof found on page 442 of Klenk and was automatically derived from that proof. ~ vk15.4j is ~ vk15.4jVD automatically translated and minimized. (Contributed by Alan Sare, 21-Apr-2013.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm vk15.4j(setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  |- wi(wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wn(wal(s0, w1)))
  -| wn(wa(wex(s0, wn(w2)), wex(s0, wa(w1, wn(w3)))))
  -| wi(wal(s0, w3), wn(wex(s0, wa(w0, w4))))
  -| wn(wal(s0, wi(w4, w2)))
} = {
  sylib(wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wn(wal(s0, w1)), wex(s0, wn(w1)))
  eexinst11(s0, wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wex(s0, wn(w1)), wn(w3))
  sylibr(wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wex(s0, wn(w3)), wn(wal(s0, w3)))
  eexinst01(s0, wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wn(wal(s0, w3)), wa(w4, wn(w2)))
  mpsylsyld(wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wa(w4, wn(w2)), wn(wal(s0, w3)), wi(wal(s0, w3), wn(wex(s0, wa(w0, w4)))), wn(wn(wex(s0, wa(w0, w4)))))
  syl6(wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wa(w4, wn(w2)), wn(wn(wex(s0, wa(w0, w4)))), wex(s0, wa(w0, w4)))
  syl6an(wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wa(w4, wn(w2)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w4)), w0, w4)
  19.21bi(s0, wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), w0)
  biimpri(wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wal(s0, w0))
  alex(s0, w0)
  a1i(wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wi(wa(w4, wn(w2)), w4))
  simpl(w4, wn(w2))
  19.8a(s0, wa(w0, w4))
  notnot(wex(s0, wa(w0, w4)))
  con3(wal(s0, w3), wn(wex(s0, wa(w0, w4))))
  hbn1(s0, w3)
  exnal(s0, w3)
  syl6(wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wn(w3), wex(s0, wn(w1)), wn(w1))
  con3d(wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), w3, w1)
  19.21bi(s0, wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wi(w1, w3))
  syl(wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wal(s0, wi(w1, w3)), wn(wex(s0, wa(w1, wn(w3)))))
  mpsyl(wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wn(wex(s0, wa(w1, wn(w3)))), wo(wn(wex(s0, wn(w2))), wn(wex(s0, wa(w1, wn(w3))))), wn(wn(wex(s0, wn(w2)))))
  ax-mp(wo(wn(wex(s0, wn(w2))), wn(wex(s0, wa(w1, wn(w3))))), wn(wa(wex(s0, wn(w2)), wex(s0, wa(w1, wn(w3))))))
  pm3.13(wex(s0, wn(w2)), wex(s0, wa(w1, wn(w3))))
  syl(wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wn(wn(wex(s0, wn(w2)))), wex(s0, wn(w2)))
  eexinst01(s0, wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wex(s0, wn(w2)), wa(w4, wn(w2)))
  mpbir(wex(s0, wa(w4, wn(w2))), wn(wal(s0, wi(w4, w2))))
  exanali(s0, w4, w2)
  syl6(wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wa(w4, wn(w2)), wex(s0, wn(w2)), wn(w2))
  a1i(wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wi(wa(w4, wn(w2)), wn(w2)))
  simpr(w4, wn(w2))
  19.8a(s0, wn(w2))
  hbe1(s0, wn(w2))
  notnot(wex(s0, wn(w2)))
  pm2.53(wn(wex(s0, wn(w2))), wn(wex(s0, wa(w1, wn(w3)))))
  con5i(wex(s0, wa(w1, wn(w3))), wal(s0, wi(w1, w3)))
  exanali(s0, w1, w3)
  19.8a(s0, wn(w1))

  hbe1(s0, wn(w0))

blocks.name: ssralv2
blocks.content: Quantification restricted to a subclass for two quantifiers. ~ ssralv for two quantifiers. The proof of ~ ssralv2 was automatically generated by minimizing the automatically translated proof of ~ ssralv2VD . The automatic translation is by the tools program translate_without_overwriting.cmd. (Contributed by Alan Sare, 18-Feb-2012.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm ssralv2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(wss(c0, c1), wss(c2, c3)), wi(wral(s0, c1, wral(s1, c3, w0)), wral(s0, c0, wral(s1, c2, w0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  ralrimd(s0, c0, wa(wss(c0, c1), wss(c2, c3)), wral(s0, c1, wral(s1, c3, w0)), wral(s1, c2, w0))

  ⊢ ([s0 / s1](s1 ∈ s2 ∧(s2 ⋂ s1)= ∅)↔(s0 ∈ s2 ∧(s2 ⋂ s0)= ∅))
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
} = {

  sbcan(s1, s0, s1 ∈ s2, (s2 ⋂ s1)= ∅)
  anbi12i([s0 / s1]s1 ∈ s2, [s0 / s1](s2 ⋂ s1)= ∅, s0 ∈ s2, (s2 ⋂ s0)= ∅)
  sbcel1v(s1, s0, s2)
  bitri([s0 / s1](s2 ⋂ s1)= ∅, (s2 ⋂ s0)= ∅, [s0 / s1](s2 ⋂ s1)=[s0 / s1]∅)
  ax-mp(([s0 / s1](s2 ⋂ s1)= ∅ ↔[s0 / s1](s2 ⋂ s1)=[s0 / s1]∅), s0 ∈ 𝕌)
  sbceqg(s1, s0, universe, (s2 ⋂ s1), emptycls)
  eqeq12i([s0 / s1](s2 ⋂ s1), [s0 / s1]∅, (s2 ⋂ s0), emptycls)
  eqtri([s0 / s1](s2 ⋂ s1), (s2 ⋂ s0), ([s0 / s1]s2 ⋂[s0 / s1]s1))
  csbin(s1, s0, s2, s1)
  ineq12i([s0 / s1]s2, [s0 / s1]s1, s2, s0)
  ax-mp([s0 / s1]s2 = s2, s0 ∈ 𝕌)
  csbconstg(s1, s0, universe, s2)
  ax-mp([s0 / s1]s1 = s0, s0 ∈ 𝕌)
  vex(s0)
  csbvarg(s1, s0, universe)
  csb0(s1, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s2)
}

blocks.name: onfrALT
blocks.content: The epsilon relation is foundational on the class of ordinal numbers. ~ onfrALT is an alternate proof of ~ onfr . ~ onfrALTVD is the Virtual Deduction proof from which ~ onfrALT is derived. The Virtual Deduction proof mirrors the working proof of ~ onfr which is the main part of the proof of Theorem 7.12 of the first edition of TakeutiZaring. The proof of the corresponding Proposition 7.12 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 38 (second edition) does not contain the working proof equivalent of ~ onfrALTVD . This theorem does not rely on the Axiom of Regularity. (Contributed by Alan Sare, 22-Jul-2012.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

  expd(wa(wss(cv(hs0), con0), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls)), wcel(cv(hs2), cv(hs0)), wceq(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), emptycls), wrex(hs1, cv(hs0), wceq(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), emptycls)))

  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)

blocks.name: not12an2impnot1
blocks.content: If a double conjunction is false and the second conjunct is true, then the first conjunct is false. ~ http://us.metamath.org/other/completeusersproof/not12an2impnot1vd.html is the Virtual Deduction proof verified by automatically transforming it into the Metamath proof of ~ not12an2impnot1 using completeusersproof, which is verified by the Metamath program. ~ http://us.metamath.org/other/completeusersproof/not12an2impnot1ro.html is a form of the completed proof which preserves the Virtual Deduction proof's step numbers and their ordering. (Contributed by Alan Sare, 13-Jun-2018.)
